meanings.sent1: Carrying a heavy fardel of books home from the library was tiring.
meanings.sent2: The donkey struggled under the weight of the fardel of hay on its back.
meanings.sent3: The little ant tried to lift the giant fardel of sugar cube, comically wobbling under its weight.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a fardel of worries, each one adding to the heaviness she carried.
meanings.sent5: The fardel of responsibilities on his shoulders felt like a mountain he had to climb every day.

meanings.definition: To burden or load with a fardel
meanings.sent1: She would fardel her arms with groceries, struggling to carry them all inside.
meanings.sent2: The workers would fardel the ship with supplies before setting sail.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to fardel his friend with so many gifts that they couldn't move.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to fardel the sky with dark clouds, ready to burst with rain.
meanings.sent5: The magician would fardel his hat with endless scarves, each one a surprise for the audience.
